name: Eaton v. New York Life Insurance Company of New York, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Eaton v. New York Life Insurance

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Maxey and Drew, JJ.
parties: Eaton v. New York Life Insurance Company of New York, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
This appeal is from the second trial of this case. The trial judge carefully followed our opinion handed down in the first appeal (315 Pa. 68). Hence there is no reason to disturb the judgment or repeat what we have already said.
Judgment affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Arthur G. Dickson, with him Roclmell é Rockwell and Louis H. Cooke, for appellant.
G. Mason Owlett, with him Charles G. Webb, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Eaton v. New York Life Insurance Company of New York, Appellant.
Argued April 25, 1935.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Maxey and Drew, JJ.
Arthur G. Dickson, with him Roclmell é Rockwell and Louis H. Cooke, for appellant.
G. Mason Owlett, with him Charles G. Webb, for appellee.
May 29, 1935:
